oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dramatic Enhancement of the Emission Current Density from Carbon Nanotube Based Nanosize Tips with Extremely Low Onset Fields
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HAZRA, KS
RAI, P
MOHAPATRA, DR
KULSHRESTHA, N
BAJPAI, R
ROY, S
MISRA, DS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: electron-emission
emitters
bundle
arrays
carbon nanotube
onset field
field emission
plasma-sharpened tip
square hill potential barrier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Nanostructures based on multiwalled carbon nanotubes (MWNTs) are fabricated using plasma of the mixture of hydrogen and nitrogen gases. The plasma-sharpened tips of nanotubes contain only a few tubes at the apex of the structure and lead to the dramatic enhancement in the emission current density by a factor >10(6) with the onset field as low as 0.16 V/mu m. We propose that the nature of the tunneling barrier changes significantly for a nanosize tip at very high local electric field and may lead to the saturation in the emission current density.
